name: thicker
text: A comment left by thicker was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by SaulBellow, radishes, mrn)

name: relaxing
text: I bow to you, sir.

name: em2
text: My hat is off to you for that wonderful merchandising concept.

name: ellwooda
text: This stip is truly the limit.

name: thesoulbear
text: The best part is Cornelius just being all bamboozled and intrigued by the query in panel 2. He is so bamboozled, he cannot even begin to guess.

name: valorgigo
text: In these economic times, I too feel that the stip is truly the limit.

name: mystkmanat
text: Thee is a teible shotage of r's.

name: horace_lung
text:
Chris, this was the one that really did it for me, way back when. This was the one that got me hooked for life.
A Triumph.

name: singtralala
text: yeah, back ca. 1902! ('cuz yo' ass is old, you know?)

name: ambala
text: I agree, this strip is impossible to read without wanting to continue on...

name: billyamericana
text: Jokes are best when uncircumcised, like weiners.

name: coogs
text: spoken like a true Turtleneck Tom

name: mortshire
text: this is the one that brought achewood-speak into my life.  thanks, chris.

name: jokercross
text: How is your mother... genius.

name: sredni
text:
Yeah, this is one of my most-read strips. I love it.
'I cannot begin to guess' is a phrase I now use often.

name: hannah
text: my first achewood, as i recall, and beautiful it is too.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: Man, Lyle really packed on the pounds over the next 100 years!

name: wonelove
text: the alcohol..

name: deusoma
text: The Japanese...

name: shutup_shutup
text: That is so funny it's actually hard for me to type now.

name: plummet
text:
it's always hard for me to type

hint: it is because I am High

name: wonelove
text: Your avatar's facial expression is generally how my face looks when I am high.

name: hellaedgar
text: Notice the gradient on Mr. Bear's hat in the last panel.

name: dovey
text: There's a gradient in the hat... A GRADIENT IN THE HAT!

name: sherwood
text: This is the same Lyle that later booked Pat with Nice Pete.  Look it up.

name: tetrisattack
text: Too cute.

name: atticusonline
text: A comment left by atticusonline was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by relaxing, STUART, Lereya)

name: sticks
text: I really like this strip; my initial response is to wish it had come later.  To make a parody of a strip so soon after its conception and before it is fully developed could appear pretentious.  However, this strip serves to develop Cornelius Bear's character.

name: envika
text: I can't imagine Lyle acting that way in 2002.

name: son_of_selleck
text: ah, so this is where cornelius got his distinctive character from.

name: joeyramoney
text: A comment left by joeyramoney was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Contrasoma, FVVS, MollyBloom11, envika, relaxing, lucas, Doc_Rostov)

name: lucas
text: You are of low mind.

name: rowboat
text: Roots before branches, son.

name: professorhazard
text:
Unabashedly fived for "Oh! That is truly the limit."

We all have phrases we have co-opted from Achewood into our personal lexicons. For me, this is one of them.

name: woodenteeth
text:
Although I like the strip it seems people are truly taken aback by lines like "That is truly the limit" and "I cannot begin to guess". Each of which I've heard a number of times from various media sources.

It's because I live in a Colony of Her Majesty isn't it?

name: saturnbeads
text: Lyle looks very dapper in a suit and tie.

name: i_pose_4_nolan
text: I say, how simply droll.

name: vice
text: Truly, Lyle pushes it to the limit

name: rbisme
text: CAPITAL

name: farqussus
text: Even one hundred years ago, Lyle could not construct a proper sentence.

name: sparhawk
text:
I guess Connie was between lectures at this time: http://achewood.com/index.php?date=08062002

Lyle put on some poundage this last century.

name: wonglers
text: I wish I could get a response such as this when I tell a joke.

name: beefsmipeep
text: Is this the same suit he wears to the wedding ?

name: jonmw
text: What is this... Everyone Act Like Connie <Weekday Here>

name: allenphreak
text: In This Strip : Lyle gives Mr Bear the old "How's your mother?"

name: lumb
text:
A shoe is an item of accuplacer exam footwear evolved at first to protect the human foot and later, additionally, as an item of decoration in itself. The foot contains more bones than any other single part of the body, and has evolved over hundreds of thousands of years in relation to vastly varied terrain and climatic conditions. Together with the proprioceptive system, it is acsm exam what makes balance and ambulation possible.

Until recent years, shoes were not act exam worn by most of the world's population%u2014largely because they could not afford them. Only with the advent of mass production, making available for the first time the cheap flip-flop-type sandal, for example, has shoe-wearing aepa exam become predominant.

name: fattypneumonia
text: In 1902, jokes such as these were considered "working the rough chuckles."
